page.title: 11KIRKELLA VILLAGE DESCRIPTION
page.content: The first thing that struck me was how quiet and relaxed the village is compared to my street in Hull.In the last census the population was 2110.The place still retains its distinct identity despite a lot of recent building activity.The centre of the village is at the meeting of Church, Packman,Godman and School lanes.Here you find the medieval church of St. Andrew's, the Wheatsheaf Inn (an old coaching inn),the village school(originally a C.of E. school) and the post office and village store. The last to are housed in a converted blacksmith's forge.Standing at the church lytch gate and staring at the timber and plaster Forge shop it is easy to see the village as it was many years ago.
